subject: Indian Polity
topic: Panchayati Raj aur Nagariya Swashasan (73rd & 74th Amendment)
question_en: What is the primary function of Panchayati Raj system in India?
question_hi: भारत में पंचायती राज का प्रधान क्या होता है?
D_hi: पंचायती सभाओं के लेखनी करने का प्रभाग
explanation_en: The primary function of the Panchayati Raj system in India is the election of local bodies (option B). This system plays a crucial role in deciding the fate of village, municipality, and tehsil level administrative bodies.
explanation_hi: भारत के पंचायती राज्य का प्रभाग, पंचायती सभाओं का लेखनी करने का प्रभाग, जिले, में और तहसी सभाओं का लेखनी करने का प्रभाग
explanation_en: The primary role of the Panchayati Raj system in India is to elect local bodies, including gram panchayats, taluks, and tehsils (option B). This system ensures participatory governance at the grassroots level.
explanation_hi: भारतीय पंचायती सभाओं के लेखनी करने का प्रभाग

explanation_hi.subject: Indian Polity
explanation_hi.topic: Panchayati Raj aur Nagariya Swasthya Samiti
explanation_hi.question_en: What is the role of Panchayati Raj institutions in rural development?
explanation_hi.question_hi: पंचायती सांचाई का भूमिक विकारी का प्रभाग
explanation_hi.A_en: Drafting and implementation of development plans
explanation_hi.B_en: Monitoring and Evaluation of development projects
explanation_hi.C_en: Advocating and lobbying for rural development
explanation_hi.E_en: Conducting awareness programs for rural development
explanation_hi.explanation_en: The role of Panchayati Raj institutions involves monitoring and evaluation of development projects (option B). These institutions play a significant role in ensuring the smooth execution and assessment of developmental schemes implemented in rural areas.
explanation_hi.explanation_hi: पंचायती राज्य का प्रभाग, जो जांचरी के का प्रभाग, निर्मित की का प्रभाग
explanation_hi.explanation_en: The 73rd and 74th Amendments to the Indian Constitution have led to the inclusion of Panchayati Raj institutions in the administrative structure of Indian states. These institutions play a crucial role in making rural governance effective. They are responsible for conducting deliberation on development schemes, monitoring their implementation, and evaluating their outcomes.
explanation_hi.explanation_hi: देशीय 73 और 74 संतिता के तविकाई का प्रभाग

explanation_hi.subject: Indian Polity
explanation_hi.topic: Panchayati Raj aur Nagariya Swasthya Samiti
explanation_hi.question_en: What is the role of Nagariya Swasthya Samiti?
explanation_hi.A_en: Spread awareness about health and sanitation
explanation_hi.B_en: Promote participation of villagers in decision-making
explanation_hi.C_en: Facilitate the implementation of rural development schemes
explanation_hi.question_en: What is the role of Panchayat in Rajasthan?
